target_markets.market_description: Venture-backed tech founders and entrepreneurs, particularly those experiencing rapid scaling
pain_points: lack of specialized therapy understanding entrepreneurship
rapid personal development needs during scaling
psychological whiplash from rapid business growth
hubris and loss of calibration during winning streaks
target_markets.market_size_indicators: 14 years of specialized practice, multiple VC funds on speed dial, described as 'world's greatest niche'

problems_validated.problem: Traditional therapists don't understand entrepreneurship - described as 'civilian attitude' and 'gulf of misunderstanding'
problems_validated.severity: High - every single entrepreneur client has the same story of failed attempts with regular therapists
problems_validated.market_gap: Therapists are 'completely removed from the coal face of entrepreneurship' and 'just don't get it'

products_tools.name: Specialized entrepreneurship therapy/coaching
products_tools.use_case: Accelerating founder development during rapid scaling, crisis intervention, cognitive bias correction
products_tools.metrics: 14 years in practice, multiple VC fund relationships

business_strategies.strategy: Running a holding company with multiple startups simultaneously
business_strategies.implementation: Managing several roller coasters at once, requiring periodic rebalancing and extraction from situations
business_strategies.expected_results: Diversified risk and opportunity across multiple ventures
business_strategies.case_study: Greg's holding company model discussed in real-time

business_strategies.strategy: Niche specialization in underserved market intersection
business_strategies.implementation: Combining psychotherapy training with entrepreneurship experience to serve venture-backed founders
business_strategies.expected_results: Described as 'world's greatest niche' with VC fund relationships

problems_solutions.problem: Founders experiencing psychological whiplash during rapid scaling
problems_solutions.solution: Specialized therapy focused on accelerating personal development to match business growth rate

problems_solutions.problem: Chasing shiny objects and losing focus
problems_solutions.solution: Learning to ignore noise and maintain focus on core priorities
steps: Process updates during leisure time rather than immediately

mistakes_to_avoid.consequences: Losing psychological calibration, believing everything you touch turns to gold, not noticing when you stop winning
mistakes_to_avoid.prevention: Having an objective outside perspective, regular reality checks, maintaining self-awareness
mistakes_to_avoid.example: Founders who have quick wins getting carried away and losing touch with actual business results

mistakes_to_avoid.mistake: Immediately chasing every new shiny object or trend
mistakes_to_avoid.consequences: Loss of focus, constant context switching, reduced effectiveness on core priorities
mistakes_to_avoid.prevention: Scheduled information consumption, delayed processing of new developments
mistakes_to_avoid.example: Stopping everything to watch Apple event live instead of catching up during leisure time

trends_signals.trend: Growing need for specialized mental health support for entrepreneurs
trends_signals.opportunity: Intersection of psychology and entrepreneurship expertise creates valuable niche

actionable_quotes.quote: I generally meet people like you the morning after the darkest night of the Soul
actionable_quotes.context: When entrepreneurs typically seek specialized therapy
actionable_quotes.actionability: Timing for when to offer crisis intervention services

actionable_quotes.quote: It's really easy for people who have quick wins to get carried away and start to believe that everything they touch turns to gold
actionable_quotes.context: Warning about founder hubris during success
actionable_quotes.actionability: Need for objective perspective and reality checks during winning periods

actionable_quotes.quote: The most important decision that me and many Founders can make is ignoring the noise
actionable_quotes.context: Focus and priority management for entrepreneurs
actionable_quotes.actionability: Develop systems for filtering and delaying information consumption

key_statistics.context: Duration of building entrepreneurship psychology specialty

key_statistics.statistic: Every single entrepreneur client has the same story about failed attempts with regular therapists
key_statistics.context: Market validation for specialized entrepreneurship therapy

comment_insights.insight: Audience seeking resources for handling adversity and challenges, indicating pain point around resilience

meta.title: Mental Models from a Shrink for Entrepreneurs
